meanings.sent1: The manifester of the plan was praised for his creativity.
meanings.sent2: The manifester of the idea received recognition for his innovation.
meanings.sent3: The manifester of the surprise party was thrilled to see everyone's reactions.
meanings.sent4: She was a true manifester of dreams, turning ideas into reality effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The manifester of happiness spread joy wherever he went.

meanings.definition: To show or demonstrate something clearly.
meanings.sent1: She will manifester her skills during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used visuals to manifester the concept to the students.
meanings.sent3: He tried to manifester his love for her through a heartfelt gesture.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes manifestered his emotions on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The data will manifester the impact of the new policy on the economy.

meanings.definition: A person who brings something into existence or makes it known.
meanings.sent1: As a manifester of change, she inspired others to take action.
meanings.sent2: The manifester of the truth revealed the hidden secrets.
meanings.sent3: The manifester of the new product was excited to see it on the shelves.
meanings.sent4: He was a manifester of opportunities, always seeking new ventures.
meanings.sent5: The manifester of peace worked tirelessly to resolve conflicts.
